This is *not* related to bug 69972. Seems to be a duplicate of bug 70214. Moving
to SWT.

Is this just a missing DLL or is the file corrupted?  Is there a missing entry 
point on 64-bit GTK.  Chrix to investigate.

I believe that you can see this error if you are running the 64 bit version of
eclipse using a 32 bit VM.  Make sure you are using a 64 bit VM.

Also, I think you might see this if you do not have a required dependency.  Can
you post the output of this command:

'ldd
/usr/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.swt.gtk64_3.0.0/os/linux/amd64/libswt-pi-gtk-3062.so'

Different person, same platform, same error message.  I'll try 'forcing' an
amd64 build of java.  The Sun download page doesn't have a Linux AMD64 build
that I can find (1.4.2 or 1.3.1), the IBM Java/Linux download page isn't
currently responding.  Found jre-1_5_0_01-linux-amd64.rpm .. installing ...
bingo.  Eclipse is starting.  Billy Biggs appears to be exactly correct.

So -- to use the amd64 build of Eclipse you must have the amd64 java runtime. 
Which makes rather obvious sense; but I do suggest a more friendly error message.

I posted bug 85699 about the error message.
